From this it looks like you could partially order tests based on what SUT c=
ode they cover. In this case, Test A is "less than" Test B. You might want =
to run Test B first as a result.

I've seen two reasons for test ordering:
=
  * Optimization--getting the whole suite to run more quickly by not runnin=
g tests that are guaranteed to fail
  * Precise feedback--getting the most =
specific test failure possible and not be overwhelmed by the failure of a w=
hole bunch of dependent tests

I assume that only a few tests will fail on =
any given run (I've measured that failure counts follow a power law distrib=
ution). Because of this I prefer the JUnit Max-style optimization through t=
est ordering and ignore the precision problem.

Regards,

Kent
